Message.Title: ATT lays off 106 in Obama state
Message.Msg: Job reductions in AT&T passed 180 for November, as the company continues to shave away positions in divisions with less demand, like landline phone service and directory assistance. On Friday, company and union officials said AT&T was eliminating 106 positions in Connecticut, 76 landline technicians and 30 commercial and marketing employees. Yahoo does not report bad news against Obama. Not even about the high gas prices or war in Iraq or Afghanistan.

Message.Title: Trial
Message.Msg: Trial

Message.Title: Resolution Copper cutting 400 jobs in Arizona
Message.Msg: An Arizona mining company announced Friday it will suspend shaft and drilling work at its Superior operation and eliminate about 400 jobs, saying the moves are the result of continued uncertainty around a proposed land exchange. U.S. Sen. John McCain, R-Ariz., said if Congress were to pass the legislation calling for the land swap, the mine expansion could result in 4,000 jobs. Opponents of the swap include the Obama administration and many Democratic lawmakers. They have argued that an environmental review should be completed before the exchange is made. During debate in the House last fall, Democrats complained that the mining company would not have to pay royalties to the U.S. government for lucrative mineral rights that could be worth billions of dollars.

Message.Title: Goldman Sachs
Message.Msg: Goldman Sachs just added Yahoo to its "Conviction List" and raised its 12-month price target to $24 from $22. The main reason is a simple one: "We believe the value of Yahoo!’s balance sheet assets and the core business are worth more than the current stock price" Earlier this fall, Yahoo sold a $4 billion portion of its stake in Chinese Internet company Alibaba, and told shareholders that it would use the money to buy its own stock. Goldman says that Yahoo has purchased 54.4 million shares this year for $860 million, and that it still has $2.8 billion left to spend. That's 76.5%. Goldman also says it is "less pessimistic" about Yahoo's core business thanks to improved revenue per search and "our forecast for upcoming cost reductions. Read more: http://www.businessinsider.com/goldman-sachs-loves-marissa-mayer-makes-yahoo-a-convinction-buy-2012-11#ixzz2E0CazqnJ

Message.Title: surprising move this morning
Message.Msg: I am a long time holder (and loser) in National Presto. The company is solid with S&P rating it an A with a 96% rating in investor security. It has no debt and pays a regular dividend of 1.3% with a big kicker dividend in March of 5-7% additional. The PE is a modest 13 (range 12-20) and it is a consistent earner although it has had reduced earnings in 2012 and expects the same for 2013. The product line is reliable and varied with no super products. I still use my pressure cooker from 20 years ago. This morning the stock price spiked up over 2 points and then dropped back to a current gain of 23 cents. What happened?

Message.Title: Yahoo not going anywhere !!
Message.Msg: Yahoo not going anywhere unless and until it is acquired by another Company . It does not have any internet news of anykind attributable to the Company that will cause the stock to rise . Stock buybacks do not change the bottom line .It will take a lot of money to cause any major change in the per share earnings . Only and until it's business income rises might there be a change in the price share . And then , the overall market may correct , which would also effect Yahoo . In other words , it has nothing in the works that would immediately cause the stock to rise .

Topic.Title: CNBC, 98 Companies Announced 2012 Special Dividends

The technicals are turning fast and now the stock will have to retrace to 14.52 before it can continue to advance if it in fact ever does.

Topic.Title: Yahoo not going anywhere !!

Message.Msg: "Yahoo not going anywhere unless and until it is acquired by another Company ." Which explains why no other company is interested in acquiring Yahoo. It has nothing to offer another company. Remember when Time Warner purchased AOL for stock. AOL shareholders would have been destroyed without the buyout, but because of the asset transfer AOL shareholders only lost part of their investment. Time Warner investors ate the rest of the loss. The same thing will happen to any company that buys Yahoo. It will destroy its own shareholders capital. While Yahoo shareholders might like to be bought out, no CEO is going to make a deal for Yahoo. In Yahoo, Dan Loeb has met his Waterloo, his Stalingrad, his Black Hole of Calcutta, his Midway, and his Desert Storm. It is only a matter of time until he hang himself.

Message.Title: Yahoo sees errors in procedure and in application of law in Mexico
Message.Msg: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Yahoo Inc believes it has numerous grounds for appeal in a recent $2.7 billion non-final judgment against it in a civil court in Mexico, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters. Yahoo sees errors in procedure and in application of law, the source said.

Message.Title: Mexico Wants Alibaba Windfall
Message.Msg: This lawsuit wouldn't be as large and ridiculous if the Mexican Yellow pages see that gold mine sitting in Yahoo's treasury from the Alibaba investment. If they are not enriching themselves with millions of free options, they're wasting it somewhere else, anywhere but to the long suffering shareholders. Hoping there is a change of heart, and we get a Santa surprise from Marissa....but I won't hold my breath.

Topic.Title: Yahoo sees errors in procedure and in application of law in Mexico

Message.Msg: That´s nice. It would have been better if Yahoo had bothered to win if it´s that easy. Relying on a technicality rather than the merits of the case in an appeal does not sound very convincing either.

Topic.Title: Mexico Wants Alibaba Windfall

Message.Msg: The thing with the Mexican system is that damages are not awarded based on how rich a company is like often in the US. In Mexico damages are awarded based on proven damage. I break your finger in the US and you get a house and my cars. I break your finger in Mexico and I pay medical expenses and loss of pay. This ruling, it no longer is a lawsuit, is this large and ridiculous because they were able to prove that was the damage Yahoo cost them.

Message.Title: So what are Chinese stocks (AliBaba) really worth?
Message.Msg: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK (Reuters) - U.S. regulators on Monday charged the Chinese arms of five top accounting firms with securities violations over their refusal to produce certain audit papers for U.S.-listed Chinese companies. The Securities and Exchange Commission began proceedings against the Chinese affiliates of Deloitte, KPMG, PricewaterhouseCoopers, BDO and Ernst & Young. The agency on Monday also moved to pursue a case they had put on hold against Deloitte. It was the SEC's widest enforcement effort yet to procure documents in connection with probes of possible accounting fraud of U.S.-listed Chinese companies, and raised questions about whether talks have stalled between the U.S. and Chinese governments to resolve the issue. The SEC said it has been seeking documents related to investigations of possible wrongdoing at nine China-based companies. Chinese secrecy laws have stymied efforts to obtain audit documents that investigators need to determine whether there were accounting irregularities. An administrative law judge will schedule a hearing to determine potential sanctions against the Chinese arms of the accounting firms, the SEC said.

Topic.Title: So what are Chinese stocks (AliBaba) really worth?

Message.Title: New Yahoo Homepage To Launch This Week
Message.Msg: The Yahoo homepage, which is a mix of mobile-friendly online styles from Microsoft’s Windows 8 to Flipboard to Pinterest, is close to its official launch, perhaps as early as this week, according to sources close to the situation.

Message.Title: Hedge Fund Billionaires Are Hoarding Yahoo!
Message.Msg: David Einhorn of Greenlight Capital, the billionaire hedge fund manager who has made headlines after scoring huge gains shorting Chipotle Mexican Grill and Green Mountain Coffee Roasters. Einhorn initiated a stake in Yahoo! during the third quarter, with Greenlight's 13F filing revealing the fund had purchased 5 million shares ranging between $14.65 and $16.23 a share. Tiger Global, Dan Loeb and James Dinan have also recently added millions of shares of Yahoo to their holdings.
